title: University Lecture in Progress
caption: A formal lecture is taking place in a university-style classroom. Focus: clear description, cautious inference, and TOEFL practice.

image.alt: A professor speaks in front of a chalkboard while many students listen in a lecture hall.

fullDescription.en: A formal lecture is taking place in a university-style classroom. The instructor stands before a chalkboard covered in detailed writing, suggesting a challenging subject that requires step-by-step explanation. Students sit in rows, listening and taking notes, likely preparing for exams or assignments. The atmosphere is academic and disciplined, with attention directed toward understanding concepts and solving problems.

descriptions.advanced: A formal lecture is taking place in a university-style classroom. The instructor stands before a chalkboard covered in detailed writing, suggesting a challenging subject that requires step-by-step explanation. Students sit in rows, listening and taking notes, likely preparing for exams or assignments. The atmosphere is academic and disciplined, with attention directed toward understanding concepts and solving problems. In this setting (university lecture hall), focus on precise visual evidence before adding careful inference about intent or context. You can highlight actions such as explaining a topic; teaching and explain how they shape the interaction or outcome. Use specific nouns and modifiers for details like chalkboard; chalk/markers to improve clarity. Tone words (for example: attentive; serious) help your response sound natural yet academic. You will practice academic vocabulary and structured responses for TOEFL speaking and writing tasks.

sceneNotes: Focus on what you can SEE (people, setting, actions).
- Simple: Mostly Present Continuous (am/is/are + V-ing) + basic 'There is/There are' for objects.
- Intermediate: Adds prepositional phrases (at/on/near), quantifiers (several/a few/a lot of), and 1 relative clause (who/that/where).
- Advanced: Adds inference language (probably/likely/might), contrast/linkers (while/whereas/in addition), and optional passive voice when relevant.
Add 1–2 inferences (why they are there, how they feel).
Use at least 2 collocations in your speaking/writing.

scenario.en: 1 lecturer + many students (adults) are at university lecture hall, right in the middle of a real-life moment. They are explaining a topic; teaching; students taking notes. A lecturer explains a complex topic to students in a large lecture hall. There are chalkboard, chalk/markers, notebooks, lecture hall seats around them, and the setting feels attentive, serious, curious. Their clothing, like business-casual lecturer, casual student clothing, matches the situation and the environment.

howToBuild: Choose the subject (who?): they / the family / the coworkers.
Pick an action you can SEE and use am/is/are + V‑ing.
Add place details with prepositions: at, in, on, near.
Add one short feeling sentence: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: They are explaining a topic.
There are chalkboard and chalk/markers in university lecture hall.
The atmosphere feels attentive.

fa.tense: حال استمراری (am/is/are + فعل ing) برای کارهایی که همین الآن در عکس در حال انجام است.
howToBuild: اول فاعل را انتخاب کن (چه کسی؟): they / the family / the coworkers.
یک کاری که در عکس می‌بینی انتخاب کن و با am/is/are + ing بساز.
جزئیات مکان را با حروف اضافه اضافه کن: at, in, on, near.
یک جمله کوتاه درباره حس اضافه کن: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: آن‌ها در حال explaining a topic هستند.
در university lecture hall chalkboard و chalk/markers دیده می‌شود.
فضا attentive به نظر می‌رسد.

scenarios.title: A memory
scenarios.en: Last weekend, I found myself at university lecture hall. A lecturer explains a complex topic to students in a large lecture hall. At first, I noticed chalkboard, chalk/markers, notebooks and the way people were explaining a topic. Then I looked closer: their clothing (business-casual lecturer, casual student clothing) and their expressions made the scene feel attentive, serious, curious. After that, something small happened that changed the mood, and we had to respond quickly. In the end, we solved it, and the moment became a story I still remember.
scenarios.fa: آخرِ هفته‌ی قبل university lecture hall بودم. A lecturer explains a complex topic to students in a large lecture hall. اول chalkboard، chalk/markers و notebooks را دیدم و اینکه آدم‌ها چطور explaining a topic. بعد دقیق‌تر نگاه کردم: لباس‌ها (business-casual lecturer و casual student clothing) و حالت چهره‌ها باعث شد فضا attentive، serious و curious به نظر برسد. بعدش یک اتفاق کوچک افتاد که حال‌وهوا را عوض کرد و مجبور شدیم سریع واکنش نشان بدهیم. آخرش حلش کردیم و همان لحظه تبدیل شد به خاطره‌ای که هنوز یادم می‌ماند.

grammarUsed.en: Past simple with time marker (last weekend) and sequencing (at first/then/after that/in the end).
grammarUsed.fa: گذشته ساده با قید زمان و ترتیب رخدادها (اول/بعد/بعدش/آخرش).

en.tense: Past Simple (V2) to tell a short memory, plus sequencing words (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: Time markers: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago.
howToBuild: Start with a time phrase: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
Change the main action into past simple (reviewed, chose, played…).
Use sequencing words to make a clear story: first, then, after that, finally.
End with a result or feeling: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: Yesterday, they explained a topic.
Then, they checked chalkboard and continued.
Finally, they felt attentive about the outcome.

fa.tense: گذشته ساده (Past Simple) برای تعریف یک خاطره کوتاه، همراه با کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: عبارات زمانی: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago
howToBuild: با یک عبارت زمانی شروع کن: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
فعل اصلی را به گذشته ساده تبدیل کن (reviewed, chose, played…).
از کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده استفاده کن: first, then, after that, finally.
با نتیجه یا حس تمام کن: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: دیروز، They explained a topic.
بعد، They chalkboard را بررسی کرد و ادامه داد.
در نهایت، آن‌ها درباره نتیجه attentive بودند.

scenarios.title: Reflection
scenarios.en: Over the past few months, I have started paying attention to scenes like this. I have noticed that details such as chalkboard, chalk/markers, notebooks, lecture hall seats are not background; they guide the story. I have also learned how actions like teaching can signal feelings such as attentive, serious, curious. Since then, I have taken more time to observe before I speak, and my descriptions have become clearer and more specific.
scenarios.fa: در چند ماه گذشته شروع کرده‌ام به صحنه‌هایی مثل این بیشتر دقت کنم. متوجه شده‌ام جزئیاتی مثل chalkboard، chalk/markers، notebooks و lecture hall seats فقط «پس‌زمینه» نیستند؛ آن‌ها مسیر داستان را تعیین می‌کنند. همچنین یاد گرفته‌ام کارهایی مثل teaching چطور می‌تواند احساساتی مثل attentive، serious و curious را نشان بدهد. از آن زمان بیشتر قبل از حرف زدن مشاهده می‌کنم و توصیف‌هایم واضح‌تر و دقیق‌تر شده است.

grammarUsed.en: Present perfect to connect past learning to the present, plus since/over the past to frame experience.
grammarUsed.fa: حال کامل برای وصل کردن یادگیری گذشته به حال، همراه با «در چند ماه گذشته/از آن زمان».

en.tense: Present Perfect (have/has + past participle) to connect past experience to the present; use since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: Say what has happened up to now (experience/result).
Use since (a starting point) or for (a duration).
Add a contrast or reflection: however, although, even though.
Finish with what they are doing now (present continuous) if needed.
examples: They have already handled similar situations before.
They have learned to stay attentive in university lecture hall.
Although it looks routine, the details have mattered.

fa.tense: حال کامل (have/has + شکل سوم فعل) برای ربط دادن گذشته به حال؛ همراه با since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: بگو تا همین الآن چه تجربه/نتیجه‌ای اتفاق افتاده.
از since (نقطه شروع) یا for (مدت زمان) استفاده کن.
یک جمله‌ی بازتاب/تضاد اضافه کن: however, although, even though.
اگر لازم شد با یک جمله حال استمراری وضعیت الآن را بگو.
examples: They قبلاً موقعیت‌های مشابهی را تجربه کرده است.
They یاد گرفته است در university lecture hall attentive بماند.
اگرچه کار روتین به نظر می‌رسد، جزئیات مهم بوده‌اند.

scenarios.title: A challenge
scenarios.en: If we were to replay this moment at university lecture hall, one small change could create a big problem. If chalkboard, chalk/markers had been missing or damaged, we would have had to improvise. Someone might have said, “We should slow down and check,” and another person could have replied that we were running out of time. In a situation like this, we should prioritize safety and clarity, even if it means changing the plan. If I had ignored those details, I might have misunderstood the whole scene.
scenarios.fa: اگر قرار بود این لحظه در university lecture hall دوباره تکرار شود، یک تغییر کوچک می‌توانست یک مشکل بزرگ بسازد. اگر chalkboard و chalk/markers نبود یا آسیب دیده بود، مجبور می‌شدیم بداهه تصمیم بگیریم. ممکن بود کسی بگوید «باید آهسته‌تر برویم و بررسی کنیم» و نفر دیگری جواب بدهد که وقت کم داریم. در چنین موقعیتی بهتر است ایمنی و شفافیت را در اولویت بگذاریم، حتی اگر مجبور شویم برنامه را تغییر بدهیم. اگر آن جزئیات را نادیده می‌گرفتم، شاید کل صحنه را اشتباه می‌فهمیدم.

grammarUsed.en: Conditionals for hypotheticals, modals for advice/possibility, and short reported speech (might have said/could have replied).
grammarUsed.fa: شرطی‌ها برای موقعیت فرضی، افعال کمکی برای امکان/پیشنهاد، و نقل‌قول غیرمستقیم برای بازگویی گفت‌وگو.

en.tense: Mixed grammar for higher-level storytelling: conditionals, modals (might/must), and reported speech.
sentenceStructure: Second conditional: If + past simple, would + base verb.
Third conditional: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
Modals of deduction: might/must/can't + base verb.
Reported speech: He said (that) … / She asked if …
howToBuild: Describe the challenge and add a hypothetical solution (If…, would…).
Use modals to infer causes from the photo (They might…, It must…).
Add reported speech for realism: Someone said that…
Finish with a consequence or lesson learned.
examples: If they had checked chalkboard earlier, they would have avoided a mistake.
They might be under pressure, but they must stay attentive.
The supervisor said that every detail mattered.

fa.tense: گرامر ترکیبی سطح بالا: شرطی‌ها، افعال کمکی (might/must) و نقل قول غیرمستقیم (reported speech).
sentenceStructure: شرطی نوع دوم: If + past simple, would + فعل ساده.
شرطی نوع سوم: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
نقل قول غیرمستقیم: He said (that)… / She asked if…
howToBuild: چالش را بگو و یک راه‌حل فرضی اضافه کن (If…, would…).
با مدال‌ها درباره علت‌ها حدس بزن (might/must).
برای واقعی‌تر شدن از reported speech استفاده کن.
در پایان نتیجه یا درسِ داستان را بگو.
examples: اگر They زودتر chalkboard را چک کرده بود، اشتباه را جلوگیری می‌کرد.
ممکن است تحت فشار باشند، اما باید attentive بمانند.
سرپرست گفت که هر جزئیاتی مهم است.
